Reader Despatch Time of Sender J.C &S.Lta. (E.S» -3t53.) Receipt Time Reed, in D.O. Time Reed, in Coding Office DateAll important Telegrams should be repeated.—Half-rates extra charged for Repetition. To prevent mistakes attention is called to the importance of legible writing.^ Telegram Code. G-T.C. From Political, Bahrain. To * Resident, Bushire. Ho. 658. Dated 15th June 1933. Son named Tea born to Shaikh Salman eldest son of Shaikh Hamad June 4th AAA Letter of congratulations from you to Shaikh Hamad and Shaikh Salma.n would be appreciated. -POLITICAL- Birth should have been reported to Bushire as important matter connected v/ith Ruling family. See Political Department Mannual page 5 para 11.D*0*No#723# Political Agency, Bahrain, the 30th June 1933. Hy dear Fowls With reference to ray telegram No.668 dated the 15th June 1933, I have received letters of congratulations on the birth of Shaikh Salman’s son for His Excellency Shaikh Hamad and Shaikh Salman. I have delivered the former, but in that for Shaikh Salman he was described as 'Naib Hakim” (Deputy Ruler). This title was, as you know, used for Shaikh Hamad in his father’s life time, but should not, of course, be used for Shaikh Salman. In the circumstances, I thought it best to deliver the letter for Shaikh Hamad and to return this letter to you. Although it would have been nicer to have letters for each of them, I think that the one for Shaikh Hamad will suffice to show your interest. Yours sincerely, The Hon’ble Lieutenant Colonel T.C.W.Fowle,C.B.E., Political Resident in the Persian Sulf, BUSTHRF.— 'pi, mmmfmmfmmmmmmrnm • - P.A., Forwarding letters to H.E.Shaikh Hanad and Shaikh Salman bin Hamad written and ^are submitted for signature nlease. rn , The letter and envelop* both addressed to S aikh Salman bin Hamad as Denuty Huler* v/e hava not been writing this in our letters to him and I beg to ask if this is to be followed by us. 27.6.33 The only thing is to send the one to H.E. Shaikh Hamad and to return the other to Bushire. iu 27.6.33

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 19; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-16; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence connected with the births of a son for both Shaikh Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifah [Shaikh Ḥamad bin ‘Īsá Āl Khalīfah], the ruler of Bahrain, and his son and deputy ruler, Shaikh Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifah [Salmān bin Ḥamad Āl Khalīfah]. The documents include letters and telegrams of congratulations from the Political Agent, Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch, the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Lieutenant Trenchard Craven William Fowle, and the ruler of Qatar, Shaikh ‘Abdullāh bin Qāsim Āl Thānī. Also within the file is correspondence between Loch and Fowle arranging the letters of congratulations and the correct forms of address to use.Folios 17-18 are internal office notes.
